page.title: 12THE EAST MERSEA RANGER
page.content: The present{RANGER}for Cudmore Grove Country Park was appointed in March 1983.He was trained at an agricultural college in Edinburgh. He looks after the{56 hectares} of grassland which make up the park. There is a carpark with a capacity of 220 cars. However on one Sunday in July 1983 some 900 cars had to be accommodated in the park. The park is used by many different people who come to fly kites, play games, walk dogs and ride horses. One man claims to have walked his dog in the park every day for the last{18}years. The Ranger's job is therefore very demanding. He encourages school parties to use the park for educational purposes and is pleased that new facilities such as a toilet block and an information centre are planned for the park.
